item.title: vlogbrothers: 'Syrian Refugees in the United States: One Family's Story'
item.description:
Join me in signing UNHCR's With Refugees petition: http://www.unhcr.org/refugeeday/petition/

In which John meets with Syrian refugees Mufak, Nada, and their five kids in Amman, Jordan, and then a few months later shortly after the family's resettlement in Rockford, Illinois.

Thanks first to Mufak, Nada, their children, and their relatives for being so generous both in Amman and in the United States. Thanks also to Rosianna (http://youtube.com/rosianna), who joined me on both trips and captured much of the footage, and to UNHCR, the UN's Refugee Agency, for introducing me to the family and providing translators.

And thanks to Mark Olsen for his excellent graphic detailing the vetting process refugees go through before being accepted for resettlement in the U.S. You can learn more about that process here: http://refugees.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/Security-Check-Steps.pdf

----

item.description:

item.title: LiKe BuTTeR: 'Star Wars Battlefront: Bespin DLC! First Impressions.'
item.description:
Here are my first imperssions of the brand new "Bespin" expansion for Star Wars Battlefront. I have to say, I'm impressed with the way it looks and how fun the game is. However, I can't help to feel like we are still getting a bit ripped off for the price of what the season pass was at launch. I do think the game is going in the right direction though. Be sure to drop a LIKE if you enjoyed! Thank you!

Cheap Games for PC! http://www.cdkeys.com/?mw_aref=likebutter

item.title: LiKe BuTTeR: 'One Shot, One Kill (PvP) SNIPER BUILD! (The Division)'
item.description:
Here is my sniper build that is made specifically to one or two shot players but still have the ability to hip fire spam close range if necessary. You can also do this build with a bolt action sniper if you want. But I prefer the M1A because it gives more options as a player. Feel free to share any changes you made to the build in the comment section below! Thank you!

item.title: DetroitBORG: 'OnePlus 3: Unboxing & Review'
item.description:
In-Depth unboxing and review of the affordable flagship smartphone OnePlus 3 including a detailed walkthrough of Oxygen OS, hardware tour, camera samples, benchmarks, performance demo, RAM testing, comparison to the OnePlus 2, and an explanation of Dash Charging.

Available Here: https://oneplus.net/

Specs:

MSRP: $399

CPU: Snapdragon 820 @ 2.2Ghz

GPU: Adreno 530

RAM: 6GB

Storage: 64GB

Display: 5.5" Optic AMOLED (1080 x 1920)

Camera Main: 16MP OIS @ 4K

Camera Secondary: 8MP @ 1080p

Battery: 3000 mAh + Dash Charging

Misc: Fingerprint, NFC

item.title: TED: 'My journey from Marine to actor | Adam Driver'
item.description:
Before he fought in the galactic battles of Star Wars: The Force Awakens, Adam Driver was a United States Marine with 1/1 Weapons Company. He tells the story of how and why he became a Marine, the complex transition from soldier to civilian â€” and Arts in the Armed Forces, his nonprofit that brings theater to the military. Because, as he says: "Self-expression is just as valuable a tool as a rifle on your shoulder." Followed by a spirited performance of Marco Ramirez's "I am not Batman" by Jesse J. Perez and Matt Johnson. (Adult language)

TEDTalks is a daily video podcast of the best talks and performances from the TED Conference, where the world's leading thinkers and doers give the talk of their lives in 18 minutes (or less). Look for talks on Technology, Entertainment and Design -- plus science, business, global issues, the arts and much more.

Find closed captions and translated subtitles in many languages at http://www.ted.com/translate

item.title: TED: 'How barbershops can keep men healthy | Joseph Ravenell'
item.description:
The barbershop can be a safe haven for black men, a place for honest conversation and trust â€” and, as physician Joseph Ravenell suggests, a good place to bring up tough topics about health. He's turning the barbershop into a place to talk about medical problems that statistically affect black men more often and more seriously, like high blood pressure. It's a new approach to problem solving with broad applications. "What is your barbershop?" he asks. "Where is that place for you where people affected by a unique problem can meet a unique solution?"
